item.title: How do I give ::master to everyone?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

If you read this nice little piece of code here it should deduce the obvious

if (c.playerRights >= 0) playerCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 1 || c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3) moderatorCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3) administratorCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 3) ownerCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 4) DonatorCommands(c, playerCommand); }

You will see that there are specific voids for each player rights commands i.e:

[tt]public void playerCommand(c, String)[/tt]
The master command would go under that function.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I give ::master to everyone?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:9, topic:450078”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=552973.msg4051843#msg4051843 date=1342587906]

It seems like you have the master command under the ownerCommands function. Move it into the playerCommands void.

He’s doing that, except It’s with Donator from what I can gather about it.
[/quote]

His DonatorCommands function is below the master command, so no. It’s not in the donators command function.
public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)[/quote]

I’m speaking with him via Skype, and he told me he’s having trouble with the Donator commands now.

Read full topic

It seems like you have the master command under the ownerCommands function. Move it into the playerCommands void.
[/quote]

He’s doing that, except It’s with Donator from what I can gather about it.[/quote]

public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)

His DonatorCommands function is below and it’s empty from what I can tell, also the master command, so no. It’s not in the donators command function.

item.title: How do I give ::master to everyone?
item.dc:creator: @chrisrocks4122 chrisrocks4122
item.description:
@chrisrocks4122 wrote:

how do i give everyone ::master?

(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”)) {
for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
c.playerLevel[i] = 99;
c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}

}

public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)
{

}
}
